title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]This board had a blown F9700 fuse and 0v on LCD_BKLT_EN. I replaced F9700 but I am still getting 0v on LCD_BKLT_EN. BKLT_PLT_RST_L measures 3.3v.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]I googled around and saw that LCD_BKLT_EN comes from LVDS_IG_BKL_ON so I measured R1981 and that measured a proper 100k.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]There was some water damage around the U1800 and Q9707 area. I have given the area a 99% alcohol and toothbrush scrub since I dont have an ultrasonic yet.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]I have done the testing with the display connected. The LVDS connector and cable both look fine. When I disconnect the display and use my thunderbolt to hdmi cable on my tv it works fine.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Would this probably be a problem with the U1800 chip since that is where LVDS_IG_BKL_ON is produced?[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Diode mode reading on LCD_BKLT_EN (red probe to ground black probe to LCD_BKLT EN)....

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 1364"]Diode mode reading on LCD_BKLT_EN (red probe to ground black probe to LCD_BKLT EN)....[/QUOTE]
I measured Pin 5(LCD_BKLT_EN) of Q9707 in diode mode and got 0.557. Is that the proper voltage?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: it is ok, water damage on LVDS connector?? maybe a bad connector or cable, screen is not been detected...

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 1375"]it is ok, water damage on LVDS connector?? maybe a bad connector or cable, screen is not been detected...[/QUOTE]
The connector and cable look fine. There was some blue corrosion on C9797 and C9799 so I replaced those two earlier.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
I checked Q9707 again and I see that Pin 3(LCDBKLT_EN_L) is showing 12v in voltage mode and 0.99v in diode mode.
There is still 0v on LCD_BKLT_EN.
I don't see how LCDBKLT_EN_L is getting any voltage. Shouldn't the mosfet only open when there is a higher voltage on the gate then the source?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
Q9706 is a P type MOSFET that will only open when the voltage on the gate is much lower than the voltage on the source. R9788 & R9789 are a voltage divider whose purpose it is to send 5v to the gate of Q9706. A voltage divider needs a path to a lower voltage/ground on the "bottom" for it to work though, which means R9789 needs a path to ground.

R9789 doesn't get a path to ground unless Q9707 opens. LCD_BKLT_EN and BKLT_PLT_RST_L need to be present in order for Q9707 to open, allow R9788/R9789 voltage divider to work, and allow Q9706 to pass power.

This usually happens when the LCD is recognized. If LCD_BKLT_EN isn't present, either SMC_LID is stuck at a low voltage because of corrosion by BIL connector or the machine doesn't recognize the LCD.

What voltage is present on pin 2/3, and 4 of the LCD connector?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
Thanks for the explanation.
Pins 2 and 3 of the LCD Connector show 0v and pin 4 shows 3.32v
Also I checked pin 5(SMC_LID) of J6955 and R6961 and got 3.45v. That number isn't low for SMC_LID is it?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: ok, so we end troubleshooting of no backlight, and start troubleshooting of screen detection. If LCD_PWR_EN is 0v on U9000(check that for me), the machine is not seeing the LCD. Do you have a known good LCD & cable lying around for testing? Have you reset PRAM? Do the resistors for LVDS_DDC_DATA and LVDS_DDC_CLK check out good?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
I measured Pin 1(LCD_IG_PWR_EN) of U9000 and got 0v. I checked the resistors you said to check and this is what I got.
R9008 -  3.08kohms
R9009 - 3.09kohms

I did a PRAM reset but nothing happened. 

The only other MBP I have is this one [url]http://www.everymac.com/systems/apple/macbook_pro/specs/macbook-pro-core-2-duo-2.26-aluminum-13-mid-2009-sd-firewire-800-unibody-specs.html[/url].
Would this be compatible with a 2012 MBP?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
Measure on diode mode pin 6 and 7 on LCD connector and carefully inspect pin 4 for corrosion and 3V present.
The 2012 models have a unique LCD connector so no other models are compatible.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 1449"]Measure on diode mode pin 6 and 7 on LCD connector and carefully inspect pin 4 for corrosion and 3V present.
The 2012 models have a unique LCD connector so no other models are compatible.[/QUOTE]

In diode mode 
pin 6 - 0.514
pin 7 - 0.543

There doesn't look to be any corrosion on pin 4 and there is 3.32v on it.
Pins 6 and 7 also have 3.32v on them.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Is there anything else I can do besides replacing the screen?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: pin 6 and 7 should read the same. Did you measure this with LCD plugged in?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Yes. that is with the cable plugged in. When I remove the cable pin 6 measures 0.605v and pin 7 measures 0.609v in diode mode.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: At this point I would first try another LCD assembly to rule that out. Don't rip the original apart it might be fine. Get another machine to test or order a cable+LCD to test.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: I just ordered a used lcd and cable from powerbook medic. Is that a good company to purchase from? I think louis might have some experience with them.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: You'll get your stuff, but in my opinion they are too expensive. But if you want it quick then sure. Make sure the cable you ordered is for 2012+ models!

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: thanks. i ordered a used lcd for $20 from them.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
My lcd and cable I ordered came in today and I tested it and the lcd is still not being recognized as there is nothing on Pin 1(LCD_IG_PWR_EN) of U9000. 
I checked R1984 and I also got no voltage there and 91kohms on the resistance.
Here are some measurements on the lcd connector with the cable plugged in
           diode mode | voltage
Pin 2 - 0.575            0v
Pin 3 - 0.575            0v
Pin 4 - 0.331            3.31v
Pin 6 - 0.604            3.31v
Pin 7 - 0.599            3.31v

Is this an issue with U1800 chip?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Check if pin 4 6 and 7 actually have continuity to the LCD side of the cable. Also check SMC_LID again to be 100% sure

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Ok. So before checking for continuity I decided to flip the cable connecting to the lcd upside down and now I am getting 3.31v on Pins 2 & 3 and the lcd is working but there is no backlight(saw questionmark folder with flashlight) so I will troubleshoot this issue. Thanks for the help if I need anymore I'll reply on this thread.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
I am getting 12.5v on L9701 as well as D9701 and the output of C9799 is a constant 12.5v and in diode mode C9799 measures 0.579 on output. I replaced C9797/C9799 weeks ago as they had some corrosion so I don't think that could be the issue.
BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN both show 3.3v.
I checked the feedback line of the U9701 LED Driver and it doesn't look burned but I do have a several LP8550's that I can replace it with.
Is this likely a LED Driver issue?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Hey [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] do you think I should replace the LED Driver since I am only getting 12.5 on the ouput capacitors?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: Sure why not?

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
​[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER]  Ok so a bunch of confusing stuff has happened since I reflowed the LED Driver. I reflowed it to see if it would work before having to replace it and after reflowing I was getting 12v on pin 3 of Q9706 and Q9707 which is too high and no voltage on the output pins of Q9706. 

I replaced Q9707 but that made no difference.

I replaced R9788 and R9789 even though they measured correct resistance because I thought that was causing pin 3 of Q9707 to be so high. I didnt have a donor board for this model so I took the resistors from a 820-3209 that had the same resistance but 1/20w instead of 1/16w(don't know if that is a big issue.)

Now after replacing those resistors I no longer have LCD_BKLT_EN and once again the board isn't seeing the lcd as there is no voltage on Pins 2/3 of the lcd connector and Pin 1(LCD_IG_PWR_EN) of U9000.

The lcd cable and connector look fine so I don't know what could have happened.

title: 820-3115 No backlight - missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message: I don't know either, replace LCD connector.
